data.title: One More Day (2023) Drama, Directed By Fred Forte Jr.
data.meta_description: Raquel Ferguson, is an up and coming photographer and single mother to a 15 year old daughter. As her business grows, it causes more strain on the relationship between them. Raquel is driven by the need to be better than her mother, who she has never forgiven for things in the past. Raquel is unable to see the hypocrisy in her own life, as her relationship with her daughter deteriorates right under her nose. When a terrible tragedy occurs, Raquel begs God for a miracle.
data.text:
Rent or Buy Now

One More Day

Own It April 02, 2024

Genre: Drama, Inspirational

Runtime: 138 Minutes

UPC: MAV-6063, 824355606324

Storyline

Raquel Ferguson, is an up and coming photographer and single mother to a 15 year old daughter. As her business grows, it causes more strain on the relationship between them. Raquel is driven by the need to be better than her mother, who she has never forgiven for things in the past. Raquel is unable to see the hypocrisy in her own life, as her relationship with her daughter deteriorates right under her nose. When a terrible tragedy occurs, Raquel begs God for a miracle.

Produced By

Fred Forte Jr., Shelton Demar Lewis, D'Angelo Crawford

Directed By

Fred Forte Jr.

Cast

Yakima Rich, Cameron Mills, Diane Carter

About the Crew

Freddie, is a writer, author, director, and producer making a true impact in the Charlotte community. He was born into a family of ministry and praise where he was taught the love of God and how to "live on purpose". This gave birth to his purpose and passion in life: writing and directing. After producing his first major gospel play "For the Love of Money", in Charlotte, North Carolina, Fred Forte Jr. decided to take "For the Love of Money" on the road. Shortly afterwards, Fred Forte Jr. went on to produce his second major play "Club Hallelujah". Fred Forte Jr., completed an inspiring urban drama called "Open Book, Chapter Isaac", performed at the historic Sylvia Theater in York, South Carolina. Mr. Forte Jr. has gone on to produce several other productions such as "My Brothers Keeper", his first television show that appeared on Channel 21. Freddie has also partnered with several community organizations here in Charlotte such as The Salvation Army Center of Hope, The Boys and Girls Club, and The Mecklenburg County Bette Rae Center. Mr. Forte Jr. is well-known for his continued support with the youth and his previous youth production, "The Crew of 42nd St".

Cameron Mills is an actress known for Addicted (2014), Fatal Attraction (2016), and Proverbs (2017).

Diane Carter is an actress known for ATL Homicide (2019), Hidden Orchard Mysteries (2020), and Lethal Love Affair (2024).
